title: Space Team Europe for Vega: final liftoff
summary: Interviews with personnel that worked on the last Vega rocket, flight VV24, with Sentinel-2C onboard.

title: A smooth start to life in orbit for Sentinel-2C
summary: Sentinel-2C has completed its important first few days in space, which saw teams on the ground working around the clock to ensure the spacecraft is ready to begin its mission.

title: Juice confirms that Earth is habitable
summary: During its flyby of Earth on 20 August, ESA’s Jupiter Icy Moons Explorer (Juice) found ingredients for life in Earth’s atmosphere.

title: The 2024 Global Methane Budget reveals alarming trends
summary: The Global Methane Budget 2024 paints a troubling picture of the current state of global methane emissions. The new report, which uses data from the Copernicus Sentinel-5P satellite, reveals that human activities are now responsible for at least two-thirds of global methane emissions.

title: Crew Dragon launches on Polaris Dawn private astronaut mission
summary: A SpaceX Crew Dragon is in orbit on a long-awaited private astronaut mission that will attempt the first commercial spacewalk and go higher than any crewed mission in more than 50 years.

title: Polaris Dawn Finally Gets a Break
summary: Polaris Dawn finally lifted off this morning after a long series of weather delays. The four private astronauts will spend five days in orbit with the goal of flying higher […]

title: Polaris Dawn takes to the skies, setting the stage for a daring private spacewalk
summary: Weather had confounded the launch attempt for nearly two weeks.

title: Chang’e-6 orbiter turns up at Sun-Earth Lagrange point after moon sampling mission
summary: HELSINKI — The orbiter for China’s Chang’e-6 lunar far side sample return mission is now at the second Sun-Earth Lagrange as part of extended activities. The orbiter was a key […]

title: SpaceX launches Polaris Dawn mission, which will attempt the first private spacewalk
summary: SpaceX’s Polaris Dawn mission launched on Tuesday from Florida on a Falcon 9 rocket, which carried the Dragon capsule “Resilience” into orbit.

title: Airbus Demonstrates Autonomous Sample Collection for Mars Missions
summary: Airbus Defence and Space has successfully demonstrated autonomous sample collection capabilities using a four-wheeled rover called Codi. Over the last three years, ESA and Airbus engineers have tested the capabilities of various rover designs in a quarry near Leighton Buzzard, Bedfordshire, in the UK. The aim of these test campaigns is to develop and master […]
